content: To enable cybersecurity engineering, the organization shall institute and maintain cybersecurity governance and a cybersecurity culture.
This includes cybersecurity awareness management, competence management, and continuous improvement.
The organization shall specify organizational rules and processes that are independently audited against the objectives of this document.
To support cybersecurity engineering, the organization shall implement management systems for cybersecurity, including managing tools and applying a quality management system.
The objectives of this clause are to:
a) define a cybersecurity policy and the organizational rules and processes for cybersecurity;
b) assign the responsibilities and corresponding authorities required to perform cybersecurity activities;
c) support the implementation of cybersecurity, including the provision of resources and the management of the interactions between cybersecurity processes and related processes;
e) institute and maintain a cybersecurity culture, including competence management, awareness management, and continuous improvement;
f) support and manage the sharing of cybersecurity information;
g) institute and maintain management systems that support the maintenance of cybersecurity;
h) provide evidence that the use of tools does not adversely affect cybersecurity; and
i) perform an organizational cybersecurity audit.
Existing evidence of conformity with standards that support quality management can be considered.
These may include IATF 16949, ISO 9001, ISO 10007, Automotive SPICE®, ISO/IEC 330xx family, ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288, and ISO/IEC/IEEE 12207.

description: The organization shall define a cybersecurity policy that includes:
a) acknowledgment of road vehicle cybersecurity risks; and
b) the executive management’s commitment to manage the corresponding cybersecurity risks.
The organization shall establish and maintain rules and processes to:
a) enable the implementation of the requirements of this document; and
b) support the execution of the corresponding activities.
The organization shall assign and communicate the responsibilities and corresponding organizational authority to achieve and maintain cybersecurity.
The organization shall provide the resources to address cybersecurity, including personnel responsible for risk management, development, and incident management.
The organization shall identify disciplines related to or interacting with cybersecurity and establish and maintain communication channels between those disciplines in order to:
a) determine if and how cybersecurity will be integrated into existing processes; and
b) coordinate the exchange of relevant information.
Disciplines include information technology security, functional safety, and privacy.
The organization shall foster and maintain a strong cybersecurity culture.
The organization shall ensure that persons to which cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are assigned have the competences and awareness to fulfil these.
Competence, awareness, and training programs should include:
- organizational rules and processes regarding cybersecurity, including risk management;
- organizational rules and processes regarding related disciplines such as functional safety and privacy;
- domain knowledge;
- systems engineering;
- cybersecurity-related methods, tools, and guidelines; and
- known attack methods and cybersecurity controls.
The organization shall institute and maintain a continuous improvement process.
This process shall include learning from previous experiences, cybersecurity monitoring, information gathered from internal and external sources, and products of similar application in the field.
It shall derive and apply improvements to subsequent cybersecurity activities, communicate lessons learned, and verify adequacy of organizational rules and processes in accordance with RQ-05-02.
The organization shall define the circumstances under which information sharing related to cybersecurity is required, permitted, or prohibited, both internal and external to the organization.

These circumstances may depend on information type, approval processes, redaction requirements, source attribution, communication rules, vulnerability disclosure procedures, and handling requirements for highly sensitive data.
The organization should align its information security management of shared data with other parties in accordance with RQ-05-09.
The organization shall institute and maintain a quality management system in accordance with International Standards, or equivalent, to support cybersecurity engineering.
The system shall address:
a) change management;
b) documentation management;
c) configuration management; and
d) requirements management.

The configuration information required for maintaining cybersecurity of a product in the field shall remain available until the end of cybersecurity support for the product, to enable remedial actions.
A cybersecurity management system for the production processes should be established to support the activities of Clause 12.
Tools that can influence the cybersecurity of an item or component shall be managed.
These include tools used during concept or product development, production, and maintenance.
Tool management should ensure proper usage, access control, and authentication of tool users.
An appropriate environment to support remedial actions for cybersecurity incidents should be reproducible until the end of cybersecurity support for the product.
Work products should be managed in accordance with an information security management system.
A cybersecurity audit shall be performed independently to judge whether the organizational processes achieve the objectives of this document.
Such an audit can be included in, or combined with, a quality management system audit and should be performed periodically to ensure ongoing process adequacy.

work_products.description: Cybersecurity policy, rules, and processes resulting from the requirements of 5.4.1 to 5.4.3.
Evidence of competence management, awareness management, and continuous improvement resulting from 5.4.2.
Evidence of the organization's management systems resulting from 5.4.4 and 5.4.6.
Evidence of tool management resulting from 5.4.5.
Organizational cybersecurity audit report resulting from 5.4.7.
